document_title: Water and Waste Disposal Predevelopment Planning Grants
program_purpose: Helps eligible low-income communities plan and develop applications for proposed USDA Rural Development water or waste disposal projects.
eligible_area_type_1: Rural areas and towns with populations of 10,000 or fewer
eligible_area_income_note: The area must have a median household income below the poverty line or less than 80 percent of the statewide non-metropolitan median household income.
eligible_area_partnerships_encouraged: Partnerships with other federal, state, and local organizations are encouraged.
eligible_area_grant_condition: Grants are awarded only when the applicant cannot afford to borrow the needed funds.
funds_use_description: This program helps eligible low-income communities plan and develop applications for proposed USDA Rural Development water or waste disposal projects.
grant_term_1: Grants cannot be used to pay for work already completed.
grant_term_2: The amount of the grant will be subtracted from the total grant eligibility if a USDA grant is awarded for part of the water or waste disposal project.
grant_term_3: These grants do not have to be paid back if the application for the USDA direct loan or loan and grant combination is not successful.
grant_term_4: Grants are based on demonstrated need and availability of funds.

program_title: Water and Waste Disposal Predevelopment Planning Grants
governing_program_2_description: Section 306 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act
forms_resources_note_1: Please speak to a program specialist in the state in which your proposed project is located before you attempt to complete your application.
general_note_1: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
